pages.text: All machines, devices, dynamos, etc use JSONs to determine their recipes and catalysts, meaning you can use datapacks to create and modify recipes. Alternatively, Thermal has CraftTweaker support, if you're more comfortable with that. Below is a link to the Minecraft Wiki to get you started on datapacks.

Below is a link to an example of a machine recipe. The first output is always the primary output, while the rest are always secondary outputs. 'count' is an integral value, unaffected by catalysts. 'chance' is a float value, affected by catalysts by default (can be changed by setting 'locked' to true).

Below is a link to an example of a Json for adding a catalyst to a machine. The machine, item, and all 4 catalyst multipliers are defined here. For more information on catalysts, read $(l:thermal:world/materials/catalysts)this$(/l).
Below is a link to an example of a Json for boosting arboreal extractor output using phyto-gro. It's pretty simple, not much to say here.
Below is a link to an example of a Json for burning refined fuel in a dynamo. An important limitation to keep in mind is that the energy value must be at least 10k RF!
